com.bombinggames.wurfelengine.core.map

Class Chunk

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bombinggames.wurfelengine.core.map.Chunk
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.ai.msg.Telegraph

    public class Chunk
extends Object
implements com.badlogic.gdx.ai.msg.Telegraph
    A Chunk is filled with many Blocks and is a part of the map.
    Author:
    Benedikt

      Creates a Chunk filled with empty cells (likely air).

      • Chunk

        public Chunk(Map map,
             File path,
             int coordX,
             int coordY,
             Generator generator)
        Creates a chunk by trying to load and if this fails it generates a new one.
        Parameters:
        map -
        coordX - the chunk coordinate
        coordY - the chunk coordinate
        path - filename, can be null to skip file loading
        generator - used for generating if laoding fails

      • setBlock

        public void setBlock(RenderCell rblock)
        sets a block in the map. if position is under the map does nothing.
        Parameters:

      • setBlock

        public void setBlock(Coordinate coord,
                     byte id,
                     byte value,
                     byte health)
        Almost lowest level method to set a block in the map. If the block has logic a new logicinstance will be created.
        Parameters:
        coord - The position where you insert the block. Must be inside the bounds of the chunk.
        id -
        value -
        health -

      • setBlock

        public void setBlock(Coordinate coord,
                     byte id,
                     byte value)
        Almost lowest level method to set a block in the map. If the block has logic a new logicinstance will be created. Sets health to 100.
        Parameters:
        coord -
        id -
        value -

      • setBlock

        public void setBlock(Coordinate coord,
                     byte id)
        Almost lowest level method to set a block in the map. If the block has logic a new logicinstance will be created. Health set to 100 and value set to 0
        Parameters:
        coord -
        id -

        public int getBlock(int x,
                    int y,
                    int z)
        Get the block data at this coordinate.
        Parameters:
        x - global coordinates
        y - global coordinates
        z - global coordinates
        Returns:

        Parameters:

        y - only valid index
